trans-unit.source: Introduction to Stream Analytics, streaming data analytics | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Introduction to Stream Analytics, streaming data analytics | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn about Azure Stream Analytics, a fully managed cloud service that helps you analyze streaming data from the Internet of Things (IoT) in real-time.
trans-unit.target: Learn about Azure Stream Analytics, a fully managed cloud service that helps you analyze streaming data from the Internet of Things (IoT) in real-time.

trans-unit.source: Introduction to Azure Stream Analytics, a fully managed cloud service for streaming data analytics
trans-unit.target: Introduction to Azure Stream Analytics, a fully managed cloud service for streaming data analytics

trans-unit.source: Azure Stream Analytics is a fully managed service providing low-latency, highly available, scalable, complex event processing over streaming data in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Azure Stream Analytics is a fully managed service providing low-latency, highly available, scalable, complex event processing over streaming data in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: It's a big data analytics service for the Internet of Things (IoT) that enables developers to combine streams of data with historic records or reference data to derive business insights easily and quickly.
trans-unit.target: It's a big data analytics service for the Internet of Things (IoT) that enables developers to combine streams of data with historic records or reference data to derive business insights easily and quickly.

trans-unit.source: Motivation & overview
trans-unit.target: Motivation & overview

trans-unit.source: Vast amounts of data are flowing at high velocity over the wire today.
trans-unit.target: Vast amounts of data are flowing at high velocity over the wire today.

trans-unit.source: Organizations that can process and act on this streaming data in real time can dramatically improve efficiencies and differentiate themselves in the market.
trans-unit.target: Organizations that can process and act on this streaming data in real time can dramatically improve efficiencies and differentiate themselves in the market.

trans-unit.source: Scenarios of real-time streaming analytics can be found across all industries: personalized, real-time stock-trading analysis and alerts offered by financial services companies; real-time fraud detection; data and identity protection services; reliable ingestion and analysis of data generated by sensors and actuators embedded in physical objects (Internet of Things, or IoT); web clickstream analytics; and customer relationship management (CRM) applications issuing alerts when customer experience within a time frame is degraded.
trans-unit.target: Scenarios of real-time streaming analytics can be found across all industries: personalized, real-time stock-trading analysis and alerts offered by financial services companies; real-time fraud detection; data and identity protection services; reliable ingestion and analysis of data generated by sensors and actuators embedded in physical objects (Internet of Things, or IoT); web clickstream analytics; and customer relationship management (CRM) applications issuing alerts when customer experience within a time frame is degraded.

trans-unit.source: Businesses are looking for the most flexible, reliable and cost-effective way to do such real-time event-stream data analysis to succeed in the highly competitive modern business world.
trans-unit.target: Businesses are looking for the most flexible, reliable and cost-effective way to do such real-time event-stream data analysis to succeed in the highly competitive modern business world.

trans-unit.source: Building stream-processing systems is a complex task.
trans-unit.target: Building stream-processing systems is a complex task.

trans-unit.source: Streaming operations such as correlations and aggregations not only need to be implemented efficiently, but also need to be scalable and fault-tolerant.
trans-unit.target: Streaming operations such as correlations and aggregations not only need to be implemented efficiently, but also need to be scalable and fault-tolerant.

trans-unit.source: Additional operational challenges layer on this, including deployment, debugging and monitoring.
trans-unit.target: Additional operational challenges layer on this, including deployment, debugging and monitoring.

trans-unit.source: The costs associated with building and maintaining such a solution quickly rise.
trans-unit.target: The costs associated with building and maintaining such a solution quickly rise.

trans-unit.source: Larger enterprises have resigned themselves to paying such a high cost with custom-built solutions, while smaller companies often miss the opportunity due to the high barrier to entry and the prohibitive expense.
trans-unit.target: Larger enterprises have resigned themselves to paying such a high cost with custom-built solutions, while smaller companies often miss the opportunity due to the high barrier to entry and the prohibitive expense.

trans-unit.source: By providing an managed service in the cloud specifically for streaming analytics, Stream Analytics tackles these challenges.
trans-unit.target: By providing an managed service in the cloud specifically for streaming analytics, Stream Analytics tackles these challenges.

trans-unit.source: With a few clicks in the Azure portal, customers can author a streaming analytics job by using an SQL-like language to specify transformations and monitor the scale/speed of their overall streaming pipeline.
trans-unit.target: With a few clicks in the Azure portal, customers can author a streaming analytics job by using an SQL-like language to specify transformations and monitor the scale/speed of their overall streaming pipeline.

trans-unit.source: The service can easily scale from a few kilobytes to a gigabyte or more of events processed per second.
trans-unit.target: The service can easily scale from a few kilobytes to a gigabyte or more of events processed per second.

trans-unit.source: Most other streaming solutions available today require customers to write complex custom code, but with Stream Analytics customers can write simple, declarative, familiar SQL.
trans-unit.target: Most other streaming solutions available today require customers to write complex custom code, but with Stream Analytics customers can write simple, declarative, familiar SQL.

trans-unit.source: Stream Analytics provides a range of operators, from simple filters to complex correlations.
trans-unit.target: Stream Analytics provides a range of operators, from simple filters to complex correlations.

trans-unit.source: Defining time-based windowed operations such as windowed aggregates, or correlating multiple streams to detect patterns such as sequences, or even comparing current conditions to historical values and models can be done in a matter of minutes via the simple set of SQL-like Stream Analytics query language operators.
trans-unit.target: Defining time-based windowed operations such as windowed aggregates, or correlating multiple streams to detect patterns such as sequences, or even comparing current conditions to historical values and models can be done in a matter of minutes via the simple set of SQL-like Stream Analytics query language operators.

trans-unit.source: Specifying a streaming pipeline is as simple as configuring its inputs and outputs, and providing an SQL-like query describing the desired transformations.
trans-unit.target: Specifying a streaming pipeline is as simple as configuring its inputs and outputs, and providing an SQL-like query describing the desired transformations.

trans-unit.source: While this suffices for most simple cases, higher-scale and more complex scenarios benefit from the configurability of Stream Analytics.
trans-unit.target: While this suffices for most simple cases, higher-scale and more complex scenarios benefit from the configurability of Stream Analytics.

trans-unit.source: Users can determine how much compute power to dedicate to each step of the pipeline to achieve the desired peak throughput.
trans-unit.target: Users can determine how much compute power to dedicate to each step of the pipeline to achieve the desired peak throughput.

trans-unit.source: Stream Analytics currently connects directly to Azure Event Hubs for stream ingestion, and the Azure Blob service for historical data.
trans-unit.target: Stream Analytics currently connects directly to Azure Event Hubs for stream ingestion, and the Azure Blob service for historical data.

trans-unit.source: Using the range of input and output interfaces of Azure Event Hubs, it is easy to integrate Stream Analytics with other data sources and processing engines without losing the streaming nature of the computations.
trans-unit.target: Using the range of input and output interfaces of Azure Event Hubs, it is easy to integrate Stream Analytics with other data sources and processing engines without losing the streaming nature of the computations.

trans-unit.source: Data can be written from Stream Analytics to Azure Storage, where it can then later be processed again as a series of events, or used in other forms of batch analytics via Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Data can be written from Stream Analytics to Azure Storage, where it can then later be processed again as a series of events, or used in other forms of batch analytics via Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Stream Analytics leverages years of Microsoft Research work in developing highly tuned streaming engines for time-sensitive processing, as well as language integrations for intuitive specifications of such.
trans-unit.target: Stream Analytics leverages years of Microsoft Research work in developing highly tuned streaming engines for time-sensitive processing, as well as language integrations for intuitive specifications of such.

trans-unit.source: Stream Analytics is built leveraging the open-source community of Hadoop, YARN and REEF for scale-out processing.
trans-unit.target: Stream Analytics is built leveraging the open-source community of Hadoop, YARN and REEF for scale-out processing.

trans-unit.source: Key capabilities
trans-unit.target: Key capabilities

trans-unit.source: Ease of use
trans-unit.target: Ease of use

trans-unit.source: Stream Analytics supports a simple, declarative query model for describing transformations.
trans-unit.target: Stream Analytics supports a simple, declarative query model for describing transformations.

trans-unit.source: In order to optimize for ease of use, we selected an SQL variant as the domain-specific language (DSL), and we insulate customers from the significant technical complexities underlying our streaming system.
trans-unit.target: In order to optimize for ease of use, we selected an SQL variant as the domain-specific language (DSL), and we insulate customers from the significant technical complexities underlying our streaming system.

trans-unit.source: Using Stream Analytics query language, you can quickly and easily implement temporal functions, including temporal-based joins, windowed aggregates, temporal filters, and other common operations such as joins, aggregates, projections, and filters.
trans-unit.target: Using Stream Analytics query language, you can quickly and easily implement temporal functions, including temporal-based joins, windowed aggregates, temporal filters, and other common operations such as joins, aggregates, projections, and filters.

trans-unit.source: While we extend the semantics of SQL in a few ways that are intuitive to an SQL user, we stay within the syntactic boundaries of the SQL standard to facilitate implementation and tool usage.
trans-unit.target: While we extend the semantics of SQL in a few ways that are intuitive to an SQL user, we stay within the syntactic boundaries of the SQL standard to facilitate implementation and tool usage.

trans-unit.source: For additional information on our query language, please see the “Next steps” section.
trans-unit.target: For additional information on our query language, please see the “Next steps” section.

trans-unit.source: Scalability
trans-unit.target: Scalability

trans-unit.source: Stream Analytics is capable of handling high event throughput of up to 1GB/second.
trans-unit.target: Stream Analytics is capable of handling high event throughput of up to 1GB/second.

trans-unit.source: Integration with Azure Event Hubs allows the solution to ingest millions of events per second coming from connected devices, clickstreams, and log files, to name a few.
trans-unit.target: Integration with Azure Event Hubs allows the solution to ingest millions of events per second coming from connected devices, clickstreams, and log files, to name a few.

trans-unit.source: In order to achieve this, we leverage the partitioning capability of Event Hubs, which can yield 1MB/s per partition.
trans-unit.target: In order to achieve this, we leverage the partitioning capability of Event Hubs, which can yield 1MB/s per partition.

trans-unit.source: Stream Analytics provides support for partitioning while processing these ingested events along both horizontal and vertical axes.
trans-unit.target: Stream Analytics provides support for partitioning while processing these ingested events along both horizontal and vertical axes.

trans-unit.source: A user can partition the computation into a number of logical steps within the query definition, each with the ability to be further partitioned into data-parallel execution elements.
trans-unit.target: A user can partition the computation into a number of logical steps within the query definition, each with the ability to be further partitioned into data-parallel execution elements.

trans-unit.source: Over time, Stream Analytics will automatically scale based on the event ingestion rate, complexity of processing, and expected latencies to allow users to customize their workload appropriately.
trans-unit.target: Over time, Stream Analytics will automatically scale based on the event ingestion rate, complexity of processing, and expected latencies to allow users to customize their workload appropriately.

trans-unit.source: For further details on implementing scalability, refer to the links in the “Next steps” section.
trans-unit.target: For further details on implementing scalability, refer to the links in the “Next steps” section.

trans-unit.source: Reliability, repeatability and quick recovery
trans-unit.target: Reliability, repeatability and quick recovery

trans-unit.source: A managed service in the cloud, Stream Analytics helps prevent data loss and provides business continuity in the presence of node failures through its built-in recovery and checkpointing capabilities.
trans-unit.target: A managed service in the cloud, Stream Analytics helps prevent data loss and provides business continuity in the presence of node failures through its built-in recovery and checkpointing capabilities.

trans-unit.source: These capabilities are provided by the Stream Analytics client-anchor model architecture.
trans-unit.target: These capabilities are provided by the Stream Analytics client-anchor model architecture.

trans-unit.source: The service is built to persist state to optimize resumption from node failure, recomputations and cache output to efficiently account for downstream failures.
trans-unit.target: The service is built to persist state to optimize resumption from node failure, recomputations and cache output to efficiently account for downstream failures.

trans-unit.source: With the ability to internally maintain state, the service can provide repeatable results where it is possible to archive events and reapply processing in the future, while getting the same results.
trans-unit.target: With the ability to internally maintain state, the service can provide repeatable results where it is possible to archive events and reapply processing in the future, while getting the same results.

trans-unit.source: This feature enables customers to go back in time and investigate computations for scenarios like root-cause analysis and what-if analysis.
trans-unit.target: This feature enables customers to go back in time and investigate computations for scenarios like root-cause analysis and what-if analysis.

trans-unit.source: These features, in combination, provide fast recovery from processing node failures, quickly reprocessing lost state.
trans-unit.target: These features, in combination, provide fast recovery from processing node failures, quickly reprocessing lost state.

trans-unit.source: Low latency
trans-unit.target: Low latency

trans-unit.source: Another advantage of a managed service is low latency.
trans-unit.target: Another advantage of a managed service is low latency.

trans-unit.source: Stream Analytics is currently optimized for end-to-end observable latencies in the sub-second range.
trans-unit.target: Stream Analytics is currently optimized for end-to-end observable latencies in the sub-second range.

trans-unit.source: This allows the system to process continually at a high throughput.
trans-unit.target: This allows the system to process continually at a high throughput.

trans-unit.source: The communication model is a pull-based, adaptive batching model that operates based on configured timeouts and size limits.
trans-unit.target: The communication model is a pull-based, adaptive batching model that operates based on configured timeouts and size limits.

trans-unit.source: Hence, events and other records are batched until the limits are reached.
trans-unit.target: Hence, events and other records are batched until the limits are reached.

trans-unit.source: Even with high throughput, the system is able to provide low latencies.
trans-unit.target: Even with high throughput, the system is able to provide low latencies.

trans-unit.target: Reference data

trans-unit.source: Stream Analytics provides users the ability to specify and use reference data.
trans-unit.target: Stream Analytics provides users the ability to specify and use reference data.

trans-unit.source: This could be historical data or data that changes less frequently over time.
trans-unit.target: This could be historical data or data that changes less frequently over time.

trans-unit.source: The system simplifies the use of reference data to be treated like any other incoming event stream to join with other event streams ingested in real time to perform transformations.

trans-unit.source: Business motivations for choosing Azure Stream Analytics
trans-unit.target: Business motivations for choosing Azure Stream Analytics

trans-unit.source: Low cost
trans-unit.target: Low cost

trans-unit.source: As a cloud service, Stream Analytics is optimized to provide users very low cost to get going and maintain real-time analytics solutions.
trans-unit.target: As a cloud service, Stream Analytics is optimized to provide users very low cost to get going and maintain real-time analytics solutions.

trans-unit.source: The service is built for you to pay as you go based on usage.
trans-unit.target: The service is built for you to pay as you go based on usage.

trans-unit.source: The usage is derived based on the volume of events processed and the amount of compute power provisioned within the cluster to handle the respective streaming analytics jobs.
trans-unit.target: The usage is derived based on the volume of events processed and the amount of compute power provisioned within the cluster to handle the respective streaming analytics jobs.

trans-unit.source: Fast implementation
trans-unit.target: Fast implementation

trans-unit.source: With Stream Analytics, you can have a highly scalable real-time event processing solution with no hardware or other up-front costs, no time-consuming installation or setup.
trans-unit.target: With Stream Analytics, you can have a highly scalable real-time event processing solution with no hardware or other up-front costs, no time-consuming installation or setup.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure, the cloud service provider, takes care of all of that for you.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure, the cloud service provider, takes care of all of that for you.

trans-unit.source: You can be up and running in minutes by simply subscribing to the service via the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: You can be up and running in minutes by simply subscribing to the service via the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: The friendly user interface in the portal walks you through a step-by-step quick start guide to get your input source configured and tested, and your output store configured and tested.
trans-unit.target: The friendly user interface in the portal walks you through a step-by-step quick start guide to get your input source configured and tested, and your output store configured and tested.

trans-unit.source: An easy query editor provides auto-complete and recommendation features.
trans-unit.target: An easy query editor provides auto-complete and recommendation features.

trans-unit.source: Rapid development
trans-unit.target: Rapid development

trans-unit.source: Stream Analytics helps you reduce friction and complexity when developing analytics functions for scale-out distributed systems.
trans-unit.target: Stream Analytics helps you reduce friction and complexity when developing analytics functions for scale-out distributed systems.

trans-unit.source: Developers simply describe their desired transformation in an SQL-based query language, and the system will automatically deal with distributing the workload for scale, performance and resiliency, eliminating the need for procedural programming that is necessary in most stream-processing solutions.
trans-unit.target: Developers simply describe their desired transformation in an SQL-based query language, and the system will automatically deal with distributing the workload for scale, performance and resiliency, eliminating the need for procedural programming that is necessary in most stream-processing solutions.

trans-unit.source: Through its built-in abilities and the use of a user-friendly portal, Stream Analytics caters to a high-level developer to quickly and easily do real-time processing without having to worry about such things as infrastructure procurement, ongoing maintenance and scaling.

trans-unit.source: Scenarios & use cases
trans-unit.target: Scenarios & use cases

trans-unit.source: Real Time analysis for the Internet of Things (IoT)
trans-unit.target: Real Time analysis for the Internet of Things (IoT)

trans-unit.source: As devices become smarter and more devices are built with communication capabilities, the expectation of what can be done with the data generated and collected from these devices continues to evolve in both the commercial and consumer spaces.
trans-unit.target: As devices become smarter and more devices are built with communication capabilities, the expectation of what can be done with the data generated and collected from these devices continues to evolve in both the commercial and consumer spaces.

trans-unit.source: It is expected that with so much data available, we can quickly combine and process the data, gaining more insight into the environment around us and the devices we use regularly.
trans-unit.target: It is expected that with so much data available, we can quickly combine and process the data, gaining more insight into the environment around us and the devices we use regularly.

trans-unit.source: A canonical IoT scenario can be described through a vending-machine example:
trans-unit.target: A canonical IoT scenario can be described through a vending-machine example:

trans-unit.source: Vending machines regularly send data such as product stock, status, and temperature to either a field gateway (if the vending machine is not IP capable) or to a cloud gateway (if IP capable) for ingestion into the system.
trans-unit.target: Vending machines regularly send data such as product stock, status, and temperature to either a field gateway (if the vending machine is not IP capable) or to a cloud gateway (if IP capable) for ingestion into the system.

trans-unit.source: The incoming data stream is processed and transformed such that the computed output can be immediately fed back through the gateways to the device to take a corresponding action.
trans-unit.target: The incoming data stream is processed and transformed such that the computed output can be immediately fed back through the gateways to the device to take a corresponding action.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the machine is overheating, the device might need to reboot itself or automatically do a firmware upgrade without any human intervention.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the machine is overheating, the device might need to reboot itself or automatically do a firmware upgrade without any human intervention.

trans-unit.source: The processed output can also trigger other alerts and notifications for a technician to be scheduled automatically based on the events.
trans-unit.target: The processed output can also trigger other alerts and notifications for a technician to be scheduled automatically based on the events.

trans-unit.source: As more data is gathered and processed, machine learning can also be used to develop and learn from patterns seen in the system.
trans-unit.target: As more data is gathered and processed, machine learning can also be used to develop and learn from patterns seen in the system.

trans-unit.source: For instance, the possibility exists to predict when machines may need to be serviced based on the real-time event streams being fed into the system, or to schedule preventative maintenance on a technician’s route when things are about to go wrong.
trans-unit.target: For instance, the possibility exists to predict when machines may need to be serviced based on the real-time event streams being fed into the system, or to schedule preventative maintenance on a technician’s route when things are about to go wrong.

trans-unit.source: This pattern of devices sending information to a processing system and potentially taking action based on the real-time processed results can be commonly seen across IoT use cases.
trans-unit.target: This pattern of devices sending information to a processing system and potentially taking action based on the real-time processed results can be commonly seen across IoT use cases.

trans-unit.source: Other such scenarios include connected cars, clickstream analytics, and facilities management.
trans-unit.target: Other such scenarios include connected cars, clickstream analytics, and facilities management.

trans-unit.source: In order to optimize this feedback loop for low latencies and high throughput, Stream Analytics can be used to ingest data from Azure Event Hubs, processing the data and sending the data right back to Event Hubs for the respective subscribed device to take the appropriate action.
trans-unit.target: In order to optimize this feedback loop for low latencies and high throughput, Stream Analytics can be used to ingest data from Azure Event Hubs, processing the data and sending the data right back to Event Hubs for the respective subscribed device to take the appropriate action.
